verses.text: The \w burden|strong="H4853"\w* of \w Tyre|strong="H6865"\w*. \w Howl|strong="H3213"\w*, ye \w ships|strong="H0591"\w* of \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w*; for it is laid \w waste|strong="H7703"\w*, so that there is no \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, no entering \w in|strong="H0935"\w*: from the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of \w Chittim|strong="H3794"\w* it is \w revealed|strong="H1540"\w* to them.

Be \w still|strong="H1826"\w*, ye \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of the \w isle|strong="H0339"\w*; thou whom the \w merchants|strong="H5503"\w* of \w Zidon|strong="H6721"\w*, that pass \w over|strong="H5674"\w* the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, have \w replenished|strong="H4390"\w*.\f + \fr 23.2 \ft still: Heb. silent\f*

And by \w great|strong="H7227"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* the \w seed|strong="H2233"\w* of \w Sihor|strong="H7883"\w*, the \w harvest|strong="H7105"\w* of the \w river|strong="H2975"\w*, \add is\add* her \w revenue|strong="H8393"\w*; and she is a \w mart|strong="H5505"\w* of \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*.

Be thou \w ashamed|strong="H0954"\w*, O \w Zidon|strong="H6721"\w*: for the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* hath \w spoken|strong="H0559"\w*, \add even\add* the \w strength|strong="H4581"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, I \w travail|strong="H2342"\w* not, nor bring forth \w children|strong="H3205"\w*, neither do I nourish \w up|strong="H1431"\w* young \w men|strong="H0970"\w*, \add nor\add* bring \w up|strong="H7311"\w* \w virgins|strong="H1330"\w*.

As at the \w report|strong="H8088"\w* concerning \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*, \add so\add* shall they be sorely \w pained|strong="H2342"\w* at the \w report|strong="H8088"\w* of \w Tyre|strong="H6865"\w*.
Pass ye \w over|strong="H5674"\w* to \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w*; \w howl|strong="H3213"\w*, ye \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of the \w isle|strong="H0339"\w*.

\add Is\add* this your \w joyous|strong="H5947"\w* \add city\add*, whose \w antiquity|strong="H6927"\w* \add is\add* of \w ancient|strong="H6924"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*? her own \w feet|strong="H7272"\w* shall \w carry|strong="H2986"\w* her afar \w off|strong="H7350"\w* to \w sojourn|strong="H1481"\w*.\f + \fr 23.7 \ft afar…: Heb. from afar off\f*

Who hath taken this \w counsel|strong="H3289"\w* against \w Tyre|strong="H6865"\w*, the \w crowning|strong="H5849"\w* \add city\add*, whose \w merchants|strong="H5503"\w* \add are\add* \w princes|strong="H8269"\w*, whose \w traffickers|strong="H3667"\w* \add are\add* the \w honourable|strong="H3513"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*?

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w* hath \w purposed|strong="H3289"\w* it, to \w stain|strong="H2490"\w* the \w pride|strong="H1347"\w* of all \w glory|strong="H6643"\w*, \add and\add* to bring into \w contempt|strong="H7043"\w* all the \w honourable|strong="H3513"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*.\f + \fr 23.9 \ft to stain: Heb. to pollute\f*

\w Pass|strong="H5674"\w* through thy \w land|strong="H0776"\w* as a \w river|strong="H2975"\w*, O \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w*: \add there is\add* no more \w strength|strong="H4206"\w*.\f + \fr 23.10 \ft strength: Heb. girdle\f*

He stretched \w out|strong="H5186"\w* his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* over the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, he \w shook|strong="H7264"\w* the \w kingdoms|strong="H4467"\w*: the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath given a \w commandment|strong="H6680"\w* against the \w merchant|strong="H3667"\w* \add city\add*, to \w destroy|strong="H8045"\w* the \w strong|strong="H4581"\w* \w holds|strong="H4581"\w* thereof.\f + \fr 23.11 \ft against…: or, concerning a merchantman\f*\f + \fr 23.11 \ft the merchant city: Heb. Canaan\f*\f + \fr 23.11 \ft strong…: or, strengths\f*

And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Thou shalt no \w more|strong="H3254"\w* \w rejoice|strong="H5937"\w*, O thou \w oppressed|strong="H6231"\w* \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w*, \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Zidon|strong="H6721"\w*: \w arise|strong="H6965"\w*, pass \w over|strong="H5674"\w* to \w Chittim|strong="H3794"\w*; there also shalt thou have no \w rest|strong="H5117"\w*.

Behold the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of the \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w*; this \w people|strong="H5971"\w* was not, \add till\add* the \w Assyrian|strong="H0804"\w* \w founded|strong="H3245"\w* it for them that dwell in the \w wilderness|strong="H6728"\w*: they set \w up|strong="H6965"\w* the \w towers|strong="H0971"\w* thereof, they raised \w up|strong="H6209"\w* the \w palaces|strong="H0759"\w* thereof; \add and\add* he \w brought|strong="H7760"\w* it to \w ruin|strong="H4654"\w*.
\w Howl|strong="H3213"\w*, ye \w ships|strong="H0591"\w* of \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w*: for your \w strength|strong="H4581"\w* is laid \w waste|strong="H7703"\w*.

And it shall come to pass in that \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, that \w Tyre|strong="H6865"\w* shall be \w forgotten|strong="H7911"\w* \w seventy|strong="H7657"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w*, according to the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: after the \w end|strong="H7093"\w* of \w seventy|strong="H7657"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* shall \w Tyre|strong="H6865"\w* \w sing|strong="H7892"\w* as an \w harlot|strong="H2181"\w*.\f + \fr 23.15 \ft shall Tyre…: Heb. it shall be unto Tyre as the song of an harlot\f*

\w Take|strong="H3947"\w* an \w harp|strong="H3658"\w*, go \w about|strong="H5437"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, thou \w harlot|strong="H2181"\w* that hast been \w forgotten|strong="H7911"\w*; make \w sweet|strong="H3190"\w* \w melody|strong="H5059"\w*, sing \w many|strong="H7235"\w* \w songs|strong="H7892"\w*, that thou mayest be \w remembered|strong="H2142"\w*.

¶ And it shall come to pass after the \w end|strong="H7093"\w* of \w seventy|strong="H7657"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w*, that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will \w visit|strong="H6485"\w* \w Tyre|strong="H6865"\w*, and she shall \w turn|strong="H7725"\w* to her \w hire|strong="H0868"\w*, and shall commit \w fornication|strong="H2181"\w* with all the \w kingdoms|strong="H4467"\w* of the \w world|strong="H0776"\w* upon the \w face|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0127"\w*.

And her \w merchandise|strong="H5504"\w* and her \w hire|strong="H0868"\w* shall be \w holiness|strong="H6944"\w* to the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: it shall not be \w treasured|strong="H0686"\w* nor laid \w up|strong="H2630"\w*; for her \w merchandise|strong="H5504"\w* shall be for them that \w dwell|strong="H3427"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* \w sufficiently|strong="H7654"\w*, and for \w durable|strong="H6266"\w* \w clothing|strong="H4374"\w*.  +  r 23.18  t durable: Heb. old *
